posts.post_content: This is really useful in a good variety of deck types-discard is good for control or mill, since your opponent will be short on cards (and therefore have less options that you need to limit, or less ways to counter your milling), second ability is good for combos or for pulling yourself out of a tight spot (grab a lifegain card or something), and third ability creates an army of the undead that will probably not be brought down by anything less than Wrath of God or Planar Cleansing.
posts.html:
This is really useful in a good variety of deck types-discard is good for control or mill, since your opponent will be short on cards (and therefore have less options that you need to limit, or less ways to counter your milling), second ability is good for combos or for pulling yourself out of a tight spot (grab a lifegain card or something), and third ability creates an army of the undead that will probably not be brought down by anything less than Wrath of God or Planar Cleansing.

Posted By: SocialExperiment (7/25/2009 2:03:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: She's not underpowered, like some people may say. It's just that she's really well-balanced, unlike the more popular and pretty broken 'walkers like Garruk (seriously, he should have been costed 5 mana, and -4 for his ultimate is WAY too cheap). All of her abilities are useful, especially the second one. She can be a repeatable Vampiric Tutor minus the life loss, and that truly works wonders in my MBC. An all around great card. 4,5/5!

posts.post_content:
A lot of complaints are directed at her Tutor ability, and the fact it sits on the top of your deck...   
well, a nice combo is Djinn of Wishes -   
tutor up that Sleep and use it during the opponents turn! They lose an attack that turn, and you get a fairly free swing the next... and the next!   
also, Ponder... etc. anything that gets you a draw benefits from putting something good on top.   
The Djinn lets you play anytime, so you can summon a creature, play a sorcery on their turn, enchant your blockers, etc  
Having a way to load that card on your top deck, rather than in hand, does have it's advantages.
